author: timbeiko
content:
Cross-posting from tomorrow's CL agenda (https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/711#issuecomment-1423020244):

On today's EIPIP call, we continued the discussion about how to better onboard CL folks to EIPs. EIP editors agreed that if CL folks want to join as Core EIP editors (which are the EIPs that affect consensus rules), we could give them "force merge" permission so that they can override the bot and not have to deal with the various technical checks in the process. 

This will hopefully reduce the friction for CL folks to start using EIPs to better contextualize proposed changes, while also being a good way for these new editors to start better understanding the process. 

I can give a bit more details on the CL call tomorrow, but if anyone is tentatively interested in being a CL Core EIP editor, please ðŸ“œ-react to this and I'll follow up with you ðŸ˜„ !

author: samwilsn
content: Hopefully you won't need any force merges (though you'll have the option!), but you'll be able to move EIPs through the process as fast as you like, and not have to wait for other editors.
